intro: Psychotria riparia var. puberula, commonly known as the rough psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are often eaten by birds and other animals. Due to its medicinal properties and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and for traditional use.
